meanings.sent1: The ticket was transferrable, so I could give it to my friend.
meanings.sent2: The transferrable skills I learned in school helped me in my new job.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand had a transferrable spell that could switch people's hats.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was so transferrable, it brightened up the whole room.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is having transferrable knowledge that can be applied in various situations.

meanings.definition: Capable of being moved from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The suitcase was lightweight and transferrable, making it easy to carry around.
meanings.sent2: The transferrable furniture in the office allowed for easy rearrangement.
meanings.sent3: The penguin had a transferrable fish that it could slide across the ice.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were so transferrable, they traveled effortlessly from one project to another.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time is transferrable, as it moves from past to present to future.

meanings.definition: Capable of being passed from one person to another.
meanings.sent1: The virus was highly transferrable, spreading quickly among the population.
meanings.sent2: The transferrable membership allowed her to share her benefits with a friend.
meanings.sent3: The rumor was so transferrable, it went around the whole school in minutes.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm was transferrable, inspiring everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: Kindness is a transferrable trait that can make the world a better place.
